column4: anyone used ekiga http://www.hotubuntunews.com/blog_9.shtml ? is is really good ?
well, it works...
oh? i should have a try. i usually use skype.
it's in synaptic so if you want to give it a try, just tick the box..
FrostRat : i guess my friends should have ekiga as well. well they are on XP/Vista
there are no info on ekiga.net - similar to skype? you pay so that you can use pc-phone. and i guess free pc-pc ?
there are heaps of different sip providers ; sipphone, freeworlddialup, etc ..
well, might take a while to understand how to use. installed edika, not sure where to start
what is a sip account look like: abc123 or just phone number ?
can be both. usually you get a name but there's a matching number, so that ppl with ATA adapters can phone you like a normal phone
mmm . it's a matter of popularity. if none of my friends use ekiga, that makes my ekiga useless -- is it true ?
many sip providers 'peer' with each other, so you can call friends on a different system just like calling another country.. (but still free)
yes. i found out now. ekiga can call yahoo etc. so i m now applying a sip account
the best answer though is get all your friends to make a sip aggount on the same provider
i m dummy. find out what sip means first ...
quick FAQ: me and friends use yahoo msn skype -- can ekiga still handle ?
i m quite new to ekiga idea
afaik skype only talks to skype ... don't know at all about the others. All of your friends can install ekiga and make an account at ekiga.net though..
well, in this case, i m not going to register. my friends are more dummy than me. they use msn on xp
nowadays, scared of accounts/password and spam - the less the better
thanks for info :D
